Contradict fact: The claim that COVID-19 is caused by bacteria contradicts scientific evidence that it is caused by a coronavirus.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the role of 5G radiation in worsening COVID-19, as there is no scientific evidence to support this connection.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support its assertion that COVID-19 is caused by bacteria and worsens with 5G radiation.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Italian doctors discovered the true cause of COVID-19 by disobeying WHO protocols, which is a problematic assumption as it lacks credibility and scientific backing.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the overwhelming consensus among international health experts that COVID-19 is caused by a coronavirus and not bacteria, providing an alternative explanation that is not supported by evidence.
